item.title: Overwatch 2 Teasing a Second Crossover Event in Season 17
item.description:
Overwatch 2 has added some Nerf Easter eggs to several in-game maps, indicating a new collab with the toy brand might be coming. While nothing is confirmed yet, this evidence suggests Overwatch 2 Season 17 might be getting a second crossover event soon.

Recently, Overwatch 2 began a collaboration with G.I. Joe . Most seasons of Overwatch 2 have only had one crossover event, though Season 16 broke that trend by having both the Gundam Wing and Street Fighter 6 collabs.

Now, it seems like Season 17 might be doing the same. Overwatch Cavalry discovered several new doodads on maps like Watchpoint: Gibraltar, Nepal, Lijang Tower, Ilios, Chateau Guillard, and Rialto, including Nerf Vortex footballs and several darts. While similar items could be seen briefly during the Overwatch 2 Season 17 trailer, the addition of these toys onto actual maps in the latest update is likely a deliberate teaser for an upcoming crossover with Nerf.

In-Game Overwatch 2 x Nerf Collaboration Teaser

Interestingly enough, this wouldn’t be the first time Nerf and Overwatch have crossed paths. Back in 2019 and 2020, Nerf released a bunch of toys designed after the weapons of various Overwatch heroes as a part of the Rivals and Micro-Shot series, including Cassidy, Soldier: 76, D.Va, Mei, Roadhog, Reaper, Torbjorn, Lucio, and Tracer. If Overwatch 2 is doing a collab with the Hasbro toy brand, it is possible these or other heroes will receive Weapon skins that will give their firearms the Nerf treatment.

Season 17 of Overwatch 2 ends August 19, so if this potential Nerf crossover is coming this season, it would have to start near the end of July or beginning of August. The Overwatch 2 mid-Season 17 update is expected to arrive around the same time, so it would not be surprising if something is revealed around then. However, it is important to note that, despite the evidence, these Easter eggs could technically amount to nothing, or be a reference to something other than a full collab with Nerf.

In the meantime, Overwatch 2 players have a lot of reasons to look forward to Season 18. Wuyang, the water-based support hero formerly codenamed Aqua, is coming in the update, with his official reveal expected to arrive within the next few weeks. Beyond that, Overwatch 2 Season 18 will also include some major features, including a Perks revamp, new heroes and maps in Stadium, and a Competitive Play rank reset. The season will almost certainly include at least one major external IP crossover, so fans should be sure to keep an eye out in the weeks before then to see what is coming to Overwatch 2 next.

item.title: 150-Player Multiplayer Shooter Game With 'Very Positive' Reviews is Coming to PS5 and Xbox This Week
item.description:
Holdfast: Nations at War is launching on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S consoles on July 9. Console players will be getting their first chance to plunge into the historical multiplayer shooter that PC gamers have highly praised, with Holdfast: Nations at War holding a "Very Positive" rating on Steam.

Holdfast: Nations at War is a bit unique among historical shooters. The game is set in both the Napoleonic Era and World War 1, and features large fights with up to 150 players total. This allows for the historical battlefields in the Anvil Games Studios title to be nearly as chaotic as the real things.

Holdfast: Nations at War is now on its way to current-gen PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S consoles. The game was originally released in early access back in 2017, and received a full release on PC in 2020. Holdfast: Nations at War has put out a trailer highlighting some of the action in the game, as well as some favorite meme moments that have originated from actual players' gameplay clips. As Holdfast: Nations at War features proximity chat, players are encouraged to communicate with their teams, as well as their opponents. This has led to some hilarious moments that have often been in-character, all while the war wages on around the players.

What to Expect from Holdfast: Nations at War on Console

Holdfast: Nations at War is a game based on historical combat, and, accordingly, gives players the option of joining numerous historical factions and battling it out on land or at sea. Players have access to over 27 classes, with 8 factions and 70 maps to fight on. Holdfast: Nations at War features cosmetic customization with over 100 unlockables, including emotes, weapons, backpacks, and heads. The game will also feature crossplay, so users on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC can all fight alongside or against each other.

On PlayStation and Xbox, players can pick up the game in one of four different editions. The Standard Edition will arrive with the base game and Frontlines WW1 DLC. The Napoleonic Edition contains the same, plus Holdfast: The Plight of War OST, Loyalist Edition Upgrade, Napoleonic Pack, and Playercard Cosmetics. The Great War Edition is essentially the same, but swaps the Napoleonic Pack out for a Great War Pack in its stead. For players who want it all, the Collector Edition includes both packs and everything else that's available.

Gamers on PC who are interested in joining in on the fun can also take advantage of the ongoing Steam sale. Through July 10, the base game has been cut to $4.99 from its original $19.99, a 75% discount. The additional packs and additional content are also available at varying discounted rates. With a bunch of fresh recruits about to join the game from the console side, there may be no better time to dive in than now.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Food Tier List
item.description:
Since officially leaving early access in 2023, Disney Dreamlight Valley , developed by Gameloft Montreal, has become a staple of the life simulation genre. With jam-packed content roadmaps and cross-platform functionality, Disney Dreamlight Valley 's popularity comes as no surprise. In particular, cozy simulation games have surged in relevance over the past few years.

For those seeking to gain an edge in the realm of agriculture and cooking in Disney Dreamlight Valley , certain foods stand out as particularly valuable. It's worth noting that this tier list may differ based on a player's specific needs, as the recipes for quests, farming currency such as Star Coins, and the best foods for stamina do vary. Regardless, the following should provide a helpful outline for those seeking to easily replenish energy and earn a profit.

S-Tier Disney Dreamlight Valley Foods

The following recipes are best for their low-effort preparation, energy required, storage, and profitability. For instance, pumpkin recipes in Disney Dreamlight Valley are worth investing in due to their high value. However, while pumpkins provide a profit of 389 coins per unit, they aren't necessarily the best option when it comes to restoring energy, generating profit, and being easily sourced. The following are tested and reliable recipes that are optimal for the aforementioned reasons:

Food

Type

Energy

Sell Price

Sourcing Difficulty

  • Lemon

Medium- Swordfish are caught in gold pools at Dazzle Beach.

Easy - A flexible recipe with accessible fruits.

A-Tier Disney Dreamlight Valley Foods

This category of Disney Dreamlight Valley recipes is worth noting, although they may not be as straightforward as the S-Tier picks. As such, these foods still offer significant benefits but may fall short in some areas. For instance, they may require rarer ingredients, have longer preparation times, or yield less energy or profits.

B-Tier Disney Dreamlight Valley Foods

These recipes are often solid choices in specific situations. For instance, in the early stages of Disney Dreamlight Valley , these recipes can be game-changing, but may not be easy to make consistently. item.title: Best Open‑World Games for Casual Players, Ranked
item.description: Open-world games may seem overwhelming, but some games defy that stereotype. In fact, some of the most enjoyable open-world games are the ones that keep things simple, relaxing, and open-ended. So whether you’re in the mood to explore, build, or just take in the scenery, here’s our list of the Best Open‑World Games for Casual Players.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption: The Case for Playing the Series Out-of-Order
item.description:
The Red Dead Redemption franchise has remained one of gaming's most revered for the better part of two decades, and it's not hard to see why. The clever, grounded, mature stories of the duology have captivated audiences around the world, weaving tales of betrayal, love, and friendship that just about anyone—cowpoke or not—can relate to on some level. But not every gamer has had the chance to check out these historic video games yet, and considering that Red Dead Redemption 2 is a prequel, such prospective players may be wondering which Red Dead they should play first.

Though Red Dead Revolver was developed by Rockstar Games and shares the same naming convention as its successors, it has no concrete connections to the Red Dead Redemption games, and is therefore not considered to be a true part of the " Redemption " series.

Unsurprisingly, many series' fans would answer this question by arguing in favor of playing the games in the order of their release. After all, this is how most fans experienced the Van der Linde Gang's story, and it is, in a sense, the most "pure" way to engage with the franchise. But those who have yet to experience either entry are in a unique position, capable of absorbing Rockstar's western epic in chronological order, without the context of Red Dead Redemption influencing their interpretations of Red Dead Redemption 2 . In other words, there's an argument to be made in favor of playing Red Dead Redemption 2 first.

Should You Play the Red Dead Redemption Games In Order?

Playing Red Dead Redemption 2 First Could Make for a Less Predictable, Higher-Stakes Story

The first Red Dead Redemption begins roughly 12 years after the finale of Red Dead Redemption 2 , and follows John Marston on a journey that sees him crossing paths with a number of characters from his past. As one might expect, this narrative premise involves the reintroduction of several key characters from Red Dead Redemption 2 , giving a glimpse into how their lives have changed. Indeed, one of the best parts about playing Red Dead Redemption 2 after Red Dead Redemption is getting to see how these characters, and the Van der Linde Gang as a unit, used to be.

But by that same token, there's value in seeing these characters and organizations before the climactic events of Red Dead Redemption 2 . The most obvious benefit to playing Red Dead Redemption 2 without prior knowledge of Red Dead Redemption is the lack of predictability: while Red Dead Redemption isn't that explicit about the events of RDR2 , the game gives enough information to form a general idea of the prequel's ultimate outcome. Thus, by playing Red Dead Redemption 2 first, players could enjoy a less predictable, more tense narrative, as there would be a sense that anything could happen.

The virtue of Red Dead Redemption 2 's narrative being unpredictable doesn't just come down to shock value or the immediate impact of certain twists. The Red Dead series is built around the moral ambiguity of turn-of-the-century America, and by lacking knowledge of the series' future, players can engage with these themes more organically, without the preconceived notions introduced by the first Red Dead Redemption .

Playing the Red Dead Redemption games in reverse order does admittedly come with a fairly large caveat: there's a massive gulf between the games' mechanics and visuals. Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the most realistic games ever made, with stunning graphics, a detailed and diverse open world, and polished controls, while Red Dead Redemption 1 is far more archaic by comparison. It can be jarring to go from the high-fidelity, contemporary Red Dead 2 to the 360-era Red Dead 1 . But as long as newcomers are aware of these discrepancies, they could very well have a better experience by playing RDR2 first.
